auth_pull.info: save authentication cookie to a tmp location

auth_push.info: retrieve authentication cookie from tmp location and add it to request headers

data.info: You can provide a json file path relative or absolute or you can use a json string. If for a given key a value equals '__hidden__' then you are going to be prompted to type it in the terminal. For json terminal string use this syntax "{\"marc\": \"__input__\"}"  or "{'marc': '__input__'}". this option send data in body in data form. ex: email=email%40myemail.com&password=mypass%2B, avoid this format for complex json object it won't work.

error_continue.info: Use this argument to discard exit program if request response is not ok

files.info: Give file path (relative or absolute) to send with a POST method, apparently any other data should be sent with --data (to confirm)

hostname.info: In order to complete the url, you can provide a string, or a path relative or absolute. If the argument is not provided and the url does not start with http, a env variable HOSTNAME_URL is searched, then a file named hostname_url.txt is searched in the project directory and if none an error is thrown.

code_info.info: print http code with information to console

code_pretty.info: sort of pretty print http code to console

json.info: You can provide a json file path relative or absolute or you can use a json string. If for a given key a value equals '__hidden__' then you are going to be prompted to type it in the terminal. For json terminal string use this syntax "{\"marc\": \"__input__\"}" or "{'marc': '__input__'}" . this option send data in body in json form. ex: b'{"email": "email@myemail.com", "password": "mypass"}'. This is the format to use for complex json object

method.info: select a method from GET, POST, VALUE, DELETE (default GET)

path.info: directory path can be relative or absolute

path_project.info: mainly use to get the hostname info for the relative url. If not set path project is the current directory.

raw_before.info: Show raw request before it is send
